subject: Photography
title: Split Toning Technique
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Split Toning Technique.

hook.text: Warm highlights and cool shadows. Split toning assigns different colors to the light and dark areas of an image.

buildup.text: The technique originates from darkroom chemical toning â€” sepia for warm, selenium for cool, cyanotype for blue.

discovery.text: Digital split toning offers infinite combinations. Gold highlights with blue shadows is a classic cinematic look.

twist.text: Subtle split toning is invisible but powerful. Push it too far and the image looks like a social media filter.

climax.text: Split toning adds color character without changing the overall palette. It's seasoning, not the main course.

punchline.text: Two tones. One image. Double the mood.

quiz.question: What does split toning do to an image?
options: It assigns different colors to the highlight and shadow regions
It splits the image in half
It only works on black and white photos
